topic: British Policies and their Economic Impacts

flashcards.back: Chairman: John Woodhead. Objectives: To investigate the events of the Bengal famine of 1943. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Wavell
Chairman: Sir George Campbell. Objectives: To investigate the causes of famine in Odisha and suggest ways to prevent its recurrence.
It blamed the government machinery for the tragedy and suggested relief measures. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Lawrence

Objectives: To provide recommendations, including the formulation of a Famine Code, development of irrigation facilities, suspension of land revenue collection during famines, collection of data about Indian agriculture and peasantry, and establishment of a Famine fund.
Chairman: James Lyall. Objectives: To recommend the development of irrigation facilities. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Elgin

Objectives: To recommend changes based on findings from recent famines, emphasising that the official machinery dealing with a famine must operate year-round to control food grain scarcity effectively.
